com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models

Class CreateBlobOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models.BlobServiceOptions
      • com.microsoft.windowsazure.services.blob.models.CreateBlobOptions

  • public class CreateBlobOptions
extends BlobServiceOptions
    Represents the options that may be set on a createPageBlob or createBlockBlob request. These options include an optional server timeout for the operation, the MIME content type and content encoding for the blob, the content language, the MD5 hash, a cache control value, blob metadata, a blob lease ID, a sequence number, and access conditions.

        public CreateBlobOptions setContentType(java.lang.String contentType)
        Sets the optional Content-Type header value for the blob content. This value will be returned to clients in the headers of the response when the blob data or blob properties are requested. If no content type is specified, the default content type is application/octet-stream.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

      • getContentMD5

        public java.lang.String getContentMD5()
        Gets the Content-MD5 header value set in this CreateBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A String containing the Content-MD5 header value set, if any.

      • setContentMD5

        public CreateBlobOptions setContentMD5(java.lang.String contentMD5)
        Sets the optional Content-MD5 header value for the blob content. Use this value to specify an MD5 hash of the blob content. This hash is used to verify the integrity of the blob during transport. When this header is specified, the storage service checks the hash that has arrived with the one that was sent. If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request). This value will be returned to clients in the headers of the response when the blob data or blob properties are requested.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        contentMD5 - A String containing the Content-MD5 header value to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • getCacheControl

        public java.lang.String getCacheControl()
        Gets the Cache-Control header value set in this CreateBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        A String containing the Cache-Control header value set, if any.

      • setCacheControl

        public CreateBlobOptions setCacheControl(java.lang.String cacheControl)
        Sets the optional Cache-Control header value for the blob content. The Blob service stores this value but does not use or modify it. This value will be returned to clients in the headers of the response when the blob data or blob properties are requested.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        cacheControl - A String containing the Cache-Control header value to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • getBlobContentMD5

        public java.lang.String getBlobContentMD5()
        Gets the x-ms-blob-content-md5 header value set in this CreateBlobOptions instance.

        A String containing the x-ms-blob-content-md5 header value set, if any.

      • setBlobContentMD5

        public CreateBlobOptions setBlobContentMD5(java.lang.String blobContentMD5)
        Sets the optional MD5 hash value for the blob content. This value will be returned to clients in the x-ms-blob-content-md5 header value of the response when the blob data or blob properties are requested. This hash is used to verify the integrity of the blob during transport. When this header is specified, the storage service checks the hash of the content that has arrived with the one that was sent. If the two hashes do not match, the operation will fail with error code 400 (Bad Request), which will cause a ServiceException to be thrown.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        blobContentMD5 - A String containing the x-ms-blob-content-md5 header value to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • setBlobCacheControl

        public CreateBlobOptions setBlobCacheControl(java.lang.String blobCacheControl)

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:

      • setMetadata

        public CreateBlobOptions setMetadata(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> metadata)
        Sets the blob metadata collection to associate with the created blob. Metadata is a collection of name-value String pairs for client use and is opaque to the server. Metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for C# identifiers.

        The metadata value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        metadata - A HashMap of name-value pairs of String containing the blob metadata to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • setLeaseId

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • getSequenceNumber

        public java.lang.Long getSequenceNumber()
        Gets the sequence number set in this CreateBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        The page blob sequence number value set.

      • setSequenceNumber

        public CreateBlobOptions setSequenceNumber(java.lang.Long sequenceNumber)
        Sets the optional sequence number for a page blob in this CreateBlobOptions instance. This value is not used for block blobs. The sequence number is a user-controlled value that you can use to track requests. The value of the sequence number must be between 0 and 2^63 - 1. The default value is 0.

        Note that this value only affects calls made on methods where this CreateBlobOptions instance is passed as a parameter.

        Parameters:
        sequenceNumber - The page blob sequence number value to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.

      • getAccessCondition

        public AccessConditionHeader getAccessCondition()
        Gets the access conditions set in this CreateBlobOptions instance.
        Returns:
        An AccessCondition containing the access conditions set, if any.

      • setAccessCondition

        public CreateBlobOptions setAccessCondition(AccessConditionHeader accessCondition)
        Sets the access conditions for updating a blob. This value is not used when creating a blob.
        Parameters:
        accessCondition - An AccessCondition containing the access conditions to set.
        Returns:
        A reference to this CreateBlobOptions instance.
